intro: Asterostoma octandra, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a cluster of white or pale blue flowers with prominent stamens, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. Asterostoma octandra is adapted to dry conditions and thrives in well-drained soils.
